values.description:
This PR implements the option to use an external libccd instead of using the embedded copy inside gazebo. It is disabled by default, so internal copy will be used unless specified when running cmake. This is needed to go into debian and keep the sync with DART.

For testing this, we have the libccd 1.4 version in a [PPA](https://launchpad.net/~libccd-debs/+archive/ppa) (created for DART) or download the [two](https://www.dropbox.com/s/57u51tsl5nen0zm/libccd2_1.5-1_amd64.deb) [packages](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pnii8se4823aa5h/libccd-dev_1.5-1_amd64.deb) I did for the inclusion into debian, version 1.5.
values.title: Support to use an external libccd

summary.raw:
This PR implements the option to use an external libccd instead of using the embedded copy inside gazebo. It is disabled by default, so internal copy will be used unless specified when running cmake. This is needed to go into debian and keep the sync with DART.

For testing this, we have the libccd 1.4 version in a [PPA](https://launchpad.net/~libccd-debs/+archive/ppa) (created for DART) or download the [two](https://www.dropbox.com/s/57u51tsl5nen0zm/libccd2_1.5-1_amd64.deb) [packages](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pnii8se4823aa5h/libccd-dev_1.5-1_amd64.deb) I did for the inclusion into debian, version 1.5.
summary.html:
This PR implements the option to use an external libccd instead of using the embedded copy inside gazebo. It is disabled by default, so internal copy will be used unless specified when running cmake. This is needed to go into debian and keep the sync with DART.

For testing this, we have the libccd 1.4 version in a PPA (created for DART) or download the two packages I did for the inclusion into debian, version 1.5.

values.description:
I enabled the wireless transceiver test for simbody in pull request #1003 after testing it once and seeing it pass. However, the test appears to pass about 50% of the time even when the underlying functionality (RayShape) doesn't actually work (see discussion in #916).

So here I'm disabling the simbody transceiver test. It would be nice to fix transceiver test as well so that it fails for tests without the RayShape implemented.
values.title: Disable transceiver test for simbody due to #867

summary.raw:
I enabled the wireless transceiver test for simbody in pull request #1003 after testing it once and seeing it pass. However, the test appears to pass about 50% of the time even when the underlying functionality (RayShape) doesn't actually work (see discussion in #916).

So here I'm disabling the simbody transceiver test. It would be nice to fix transceiver test as well so that it fails for tests without the RayShape implemented.
summary.html:
I enabled the wireless transceiver test for simbody in pull request #1003 after testing it once and seeing it pass. However, the test appears to pass about 50% of the time even when the underlying functionality (RayShape) doesn't actually work (see discussion in #916).

So here I'm disabling the simbody transceiver test. It would be nice to fix transceiver test as well so that it fails for tests without the RayShape implemented.

values.description:
This pull request implements functions to get inertial information for a link in the world frame. Currently, the Inertial class does not have a pointer to its parent link, so it can't find its world pose. So these functions are added to the Link class instead.

I also added a test for the `Link::GetWorldInertialPose` and `Link::GetWorldInertiaMatrix` functions. I added it to the INTEGRATION_physics_friction test, since I had added a useful box spawning function to that test. I made a todo in the code to move the test to a more logical location once the SpawnBox function has been moved up to ServerFixture. I guess the ServerFixture.cc file has gotten so big that I didn't want to add to it. But that's a tangent...

Other things:

* I noticed that bullet wasn't using the inertial pose offset, so I fixed that in BulletMotionState.
* Simbody was segfaulting in the GetWorldInertia when calling SetGravity in a blank world. I fixed that in SimbodyPhysics and added a test in physics_thread_safe.
* I added a test for the `Link::SetLinearVel` and `Link::SetAngularVel` functions in physics_link.cc (which is where I intend the GetWorldInertia test to go once the spawner is moved).
values.title: Link::GetWorldInertia functions and new tests

summary.raw:
This pull request implements functions to get inertial information for a link in the world frame. Currently, the Inertial class does not have a pointer to its parent link, so it can't find its world pose. So these functions are added to the Link class instead.

I also added a test for the `Link::GetWorldInertialPose` and `Link::GetWorldInertiaMatrix` functions. I added it to the INTEGRATION_physics_friction test, since I had added a useful box spawning function to that test. I made a todo in the code to move the test to a more logical location once the SpawnBox function has been moved up to ServerFixture. I guess the ServerFixture.cc file has gotten so big that I didn't want to add to it. But that's a tangent...

Other things:

* I noticed that bullet wasn't using the inertial pose offset, so I fixed that in BulletMotionState.
* Simbody was segfaulting in the GetWorldInertia when calling SetGravity in a blank world. I fixed that in SimbodyPhysics and added a test in physics_thread_safe.
* I added a test for the `Link::SetLinearVel` and `Link::SetAngularVel` functions in physics_link.cc (which is where I intend the GetWorldInertia test to go once the spawner is moved).
summary.html:
This pull request implements functions to get inertial information for a link in the world frame. Currently, the Inertial class does not have a pointer to its parent link, so it can't find its world pose. So these functions are added to the Link class instead.

I also added a test for the Link::GetWorldInertialPose and Link::GetWorldInertiaMatrix functions. I added it to the INTEGRATION_physics_friction test, since I had added a useful box spawning function to that test. I made a todo in the code to move the test to a more logical location once the SpawnBox function has been moved up to ServerFixture. I guess the ServerFixture.cc file has gotten so big that I didn't want to add to it. But that's a tangent...

Other things:

  • I noticed that bullet wasn't using the inertial pose offset, so I fixed that in BulletMotionState.
  • Simbody was segfaulting in the GetWorldInertia when calling SetGravity in a blank world. I fixed that in SimbodyPhysics and added a test in physics_thread_safe.
  • I added a test for the Link::SetLinearVel and Link::SetAngularVel functions in physics_link.cc (which is where I intend the GetWorldInertia test to go once the spawner is moved).

values.description:
Basic math; added some tests.

Also, I noticed an inconsistency in the names of constants; Vector3 uses CamelCase, but Matrix4 uses all caps:
~~~
gazebo::math::Vector3::Zero
gazebo::math::Vector3::UnitX
gazebo::math::Matrix4::ZERO
gazebo::math::Matrix4::IDENTITY
~~~
I used all caps for Matrix3::ZERO and Matrix3::IDENTITY.
values.title: Allow Matrix3 * Vector3, add some Matrix3 constants

summary.raw:
Basic math; added some tests.

Also, I noticed an inconsistency in the names of constants; Vector3 uses CamelCase, but Matrix4 uses all caps:
~~~
gazebo::math::Vector3::Zero
gazebo::math::Vector3::UnitX
gazebo::math::Matrix4::ZERO
gazebo::math::Matrix4::IDENTITY
~~~
I used all caps for Matrix3::ZERO and Matrix3::IDENTITY.
summary.html:
Basic math; added some tests.

Also, I noticed an inconsistency in the names of constants; Vector3 uses CamelCase, but Matrix4 uses all caps:

gazebo::math::Vector3::Zero
gazebo::math::Vector3::UnitX
gazebo::math::Matrix4::ZERO
gazebo::math::Matrix4::IDENTITY

I used all caps for Matrix3::ZERO and Matrix3::IDENTITY.

values.description:
1. Suppress warnings in external headers:

    * deps/opende/OPCODE/Opcode.h
    * gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qtpropertybrowserutils.cpp
    * gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qttreepropertybrowser.cpp
    * gazebo/rendering/skyx/include/Prerequisites.h

1. Similar to 1, create ffmpeg_inc.h with `#pragma clang system_header` to prevent ffmpeg warnings

    * gazebo/common/AudioDecoder.cc
    * gazebo/common/AudioDecoder_TEST.cc
    * gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc
    * gazebo/common/Video.cc

1. Unused variables

    * gazebo/Server.hh
    * gazebo/gui/*Maker.cc
    * gazebo/rendering/OrbitViewController.hh
    * plugins/DiffDrivePlugin.hh

1. Suppress warnings about overloaded virtual. The warning occurs because we're using our own SM2Profile class instead of `OGRE::SM2Profile`.

    * gazebo/rendering/Heightmap.hh

1. Rename function to avoid overloaded virtual warning.

    * test/integration/pr2.cc

1. Unused function arguments when CEGUI is not installed.

    * gazebo/rendering/GUIOverlay.hh

1. Fixed casting from double to int in Time_TEST, assuming that we wanted to test the Time constructor that takes a double as input (just one argument).

    * gazebo/common/Time_TEST.cc

1. Wrap `#define SIZE_MAX` in `#ifndef`

    * deps/opende/src/util.h
values.title: Fix more clang warnings

summary.html:
1. Suppress warnings in external headers:

    • deps/opende/OPCODE/Opcode.h
    • gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qtpropertybrowserutils.cpp
    • gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qttreepropertybrowser.cpp
    • gazebo/rendering/skyx/include/Prerequisites.h

  2. Similar to 1, create ffmpeg_inc.h with #pragma clang system_header to prevent ffmpeg warnings

    • gazebo/common/AudioDecoder.cc
    • gazebo/common/AudioDecoder_TEST.cc
    • gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc
    • gazebo/common/Video.cc

  3. Unused variables

    • gazebo/Server.hh
    • gazebo/gui/*Maker.cc
    • gazebo/rendering/OrbitViewController.hh
    • plugins/DiffDrivePlugin.hh

  4. Suppress warnings about overloaded virtual. The warning occurs because we're using our own SM2Profile class instead of OGRE::SM2Profile.

    • gazebo/rendering/Heightmap.hh

  5. Rename function to avoid overloaded virtual warning.

    • test/integration/pr2.cc

  6. Unused function arguments when CEGUI is not installed.

    • gazebo/rendering/GUIOverlay.hh

  7. Fixed casting from double to int in Time_TEST, assuming that we wanted to test the Time constructor that takes a double as input (just one argument).

    • gazebo/common/Time_TEST.cc

  8. Wrap #define SIZE_MAX in #ifndef

    • deps/opende/src/util.h

values.description:
Added test for proper removal of force/torque sensor plugins. Without the Joint::Fini() method it causes a segfault, while with the sensor removal added in the Joint::Fini() method it runs smoothly. 

The test has a fairly long waiting period hardcoded that I have copied from another model removal test ( #!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/integration/world.cc#cl-46 ) I guess that if this causes problem (the test takes too much time) it can be reduced or substituted by another check.
values.title: Add test for issue #1112

summary.raw:
Added test for proper removal of force/torque sensor plugins. Without the Joint::Fini() method it causes a segfault, while with the sensor removal added in the Joint::Fini() method it runs smoothly. 

The test has a fairly long waiting period hardcoded that I have copied from another model removal test ( #!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/integration/world.cc#cl-46 ) I guess that if this causes problem (the test takes too much time) it can be reduced or substituted by another check.
summary.html:
Added test for proper removal of force/torque sensor plugins. Without the Joint::Fini() method it causes a segfault, while with the sensor removal added in the Joint::Fini() method it runs smoothly.

The test has a fairly long waiting period hardcoded that I have copied from another model removal test ( #!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/integration/world.cc#cl-46 ) I guess that if this causes problem (the test takes too much time) it can be reduced or substituted by another check.

values.description:
Several functions from libavutil are used in libgazebo_common, but
only libavcodec was linked. While libavutil is a runtime libary dependency
of libavcodec, it does not become a direct runtime library dependency of
libgazebo_common. This means it will fail to link if LD_LIBRARY_PATH
is not set up properly or, more seriously, if using a linker which is
strict (like GNU GoLD).

tl;dr This enables Gazebo to be built with the GNU GoLD linker.
values.title: Fix second-order dynamic library dependency (makes gazebo buildable with the GNU GoLD linker)

summary.raw:
Several functions from libavutil are used in libgazebo_common, but
only libavcodec was linked. While libavutil is a runtime libary dependency
of libavcodec, it does not become a direct runtime library dependency of
libgazebo_common. This means it will fail to link if LD_LIBRARY_PATH
is not set up properly or, more seriously, if using a linker which is
strict (like GNU GoLD).

tl;dr This enables Gazebo to be built with the GNU GoLD linker.
summary.html:
Several functions from libavutil are used in libgazebo_common, but only libavcodec was linked. While libavutil is a runtime libary dependency of libavcodec, it does not become a direct runtime library dependency of libgazebo_common. This means it will fail to link if LD_LIBRARY_PATH is not set up properly or, more seriously, if using a linker which is strict (like GNU GoLD).

tl;dr This enables Gazebo to be built with the GNU GoLD linker.

values.description: Types were declared as double when the function accepts btScalar, which can be either float or double, as parameters.
values.title: Fix compiler error due to specified double type instead of btScalar in BulletUniversalJoint.cc on Apple LLVM version 5.1 (clang-503.0.38) (based on LLVM 3.4svn)

summary.raw: Types were declared as double when the function accepts btScalar, which can be either float or double, as parameters.
summary.html: Types were declared as double when the function accepts btScalar, which can be either float or double, as parameters.

values.description:
Main changes here are:

  - Deprecate ode specifics in `PhysicsEngine.hh`, replace with a more general `SetParam`.
  - Update bullet/dart/ode/simbody implementations of SetParam.  Breakage in API includes:
       - changes of `void SetParam` to `bool SetParam`, returns false on failure to set parameter.
       - update implementation of simobdy header for upcoming integrator changes.
values.title: isolate changes from pull request #999, only updating physics headers without introducing new features.

summary.raw:
Main changes here are:

  - Deprecate ode specifics in `PhysicsEngine.hh`, replace with a more general `SetParam`.
  - Update bullet/dart/ode/simbody implementations of SetParam.  Breakage in API includes:
       - changes of `void SetParam` to `bool SetParam`, returns false on failure to set parameter.
       - update implementation of simobdy header for upcoming integrator changes.
summary.html:
Main changes here are:

  • Deprecate ode specifics in PhysicsEngine.hh, replace with a more general SetParam.
  • Update bullet/dart/ode/simbody implementations of SetParam. Breakage in API includes:
    • changes of void SetParam to bool SetParam, returns false on failure to set parameter.
    • update implementation of simobdy header for upcoming integrator changes.

values.description: We were installing the pkgconfig file in an arch independent path (lib/) without a good reason to do that (the pkg-config file points to arch dependant files).
values.title: Install pkg-config file in an arch dependant path  (-> 3.0)

summary.raw: We were installing the pkgconfig file in an arch independent path (lib/) without a good reason to do that (the pkg-config file points to arch dependant files).
summary.html: We were installing the pkgconfig file in an arch independent path (lib/) without a good reason to do that (the pkg-config file points to arch dependant files).

values.description:
When there is an existing pull request from a fork that has been deleted (for example pull request #1018), the `tools/bitbucket_pullrequests` tool will fail to list open pull requests with the following message:
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:25:in `initialize': undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `new'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `block in listPullRequests'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `each'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `listPullRequests'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:176:in `<main>'
~~~
This pull request fixes its behavior and pads the missing fields with spaces to preserve alignment in the big list.
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
 1018                    de20d7921de6    default
~~~
values.title: Fix bitbucket_pullrequests tool when a fork has been deleted

summary.raw:

~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:25:in `initialize': undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `new'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `block in listPullRequests'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `each'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `listPullRequests'
	from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:176:in `<main>'
~~~
This pull request fixes its behavior and pads the missing fields with spaces to preserve alignment in the big list.
~~~
$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
 1018                    de20d7921de6    default
~~~
summary.html:
When there is an existing pull request from a fork that has been deleted (for example pull request #1018), the tools/bitbucket_pullrequests tool will fail to list open pull requests with the following message:

$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:25:in `initialize': undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
    from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `new'
    from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `block in listPullRequests'
    from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `each'
    from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:61:in `listPullRequests'
    from tools/bitbucket_pullrequests:176:in `<main>'

This pull request fixes its behavior and pads the missing fields with spaces to preserve alignment in the big list.

$ tools/bitbucket_pullrequests -s 1018
 1018                    de20d7921de6    default

values.description:
Graft of this pull request for gazebo_3.0:

values.description:
There is potential risk of generating a segfault on the ```this->contacts``` vector in Gripper class. The ```Gripper::OnUpdate()``` can run a clear on the vector while the function ```Gripper::OnContacts``` is doing a push_back.

Long version with details in issue #1013

I consider this issue as a latent segfault affecting 3.0 release.
values.title: Protect parallel write/read access to vector in Gripper.cc (issue #1013)

summary.raw:
There is potential risk of generating a segfault on the ```this->contacts``` vector in Gripper class. The ```Gripper::OnUpdate()``` can run a clear on the vector while the function ```Gripper::OnContacts``` is doing a push_back.

Long version with details in issue #1013

I consider this issue as a latent segfault affecting 3.0 release.
summary.html:
There is potential risk of generating a segfault on the this->contacts vector in Gripper class. The Gripper::OnUpdate() can run a clear on the vector while the function Gripper::OnContacts is doing a push_back.

Long version with details in issue #1013

I consider this issue as a latent segfault affecting 3.0 release.

summary.html: There is duplicate code for searching for Bullet support in our SearchForStuff.cmake in the 1.9 branch. This pull request remove the old call without a minor version. The bug is not present in default branch.

values.description:
This is a backport of pull request #1038 to the gazebo 2.2 branch.

It is mainly an exercise of keeping ABI stable using available mechanisms. In this case, I've used a static data member (the only type that can keep ABI stable) to declare the mutex. That implies that the mutex will be shared by all the instances of the Gripper class, but I don't see a major problem with that more than losing performance, which it is probably better than a segfault.
values.title: Backport Gripper fix to 2.2 branch (->2.2)

summary.raw:
This is a backport of pull request #1038 to the gazebo 2.2 branch.

It is mainly an exercise of keeping ABI stable using available mechanisms. In this case, I've used a static data member (the only type that can keep ABI stable) to declare the mutex. That implies that the mutex will be shared by all the instances of the Gripper class, but I don't see a major problem with that more than losing performance, which it is probably better than a segfault.
summary.html:
This is a backport of pull request #1038 to the gazebo 2.2 branch.

It is mainly an exercise of keeping ABI stable using available mechanisms. In this case, I've used a static data member (the only type that can keep ABI stable) to declare the mutex. That implies that the mutex will be shared by all the instances of the Gripper class, but I don't see a major problem with that more than losing performance, which it is probably better than a segfault.

values.description:
issue #1127

The function was not working because the visual's bounding box was in local coordinates but the function needed world coordinates.

Added a camera visible test and merged it with camera follow test into a single file `camera.cc`
values.title: Fix Camera isVisible function

summary.raw:
issue #1127

The function was not working because the visual's bounding box was in local coordinates but the function needed world coordinates.

Added a camera visible test and merged it with camera follow test into a single file `camera.cc`
summary.html:
issue #1127

The function was not working because the visual's bounding box was in local coordinates but the function needed world coordinates.

Added a camera visible test and merged it with camera follow test into a single file camera.cc

values.description:
issue #1024

- fix time panel height and squashed icons

- fix disabled icon pixmap transparency issue

Time Panel's [new look](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xxc3up1zq55x5rl/gazebo_time_panel_osx.png) should be no different  than (or very similar to)  the one in ubuntu.
values.title: Time Panel layout adjustment for OSX

summary.raw:
issue #1024

- fix time panel height and squashed icons

- fix disabled icon pixmap transparency issue

Time Panel's [new look](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xxc3up1zq55x5rl/gazebo_time_panel_osx.png) should be no different  than (or very similar to)  the one in ubuntu.
summary.html:
issue #1024

  • fix time panel height and squashed icons

  • fix disabled icon pixmap transparency issue

Time Panel's new look should be no different than (or very similar to) the one in ubuntu.

values.description:
Our bullseye license has expired, and it motivated me to get an open source coverage tool in place. This will also let external users who don't have bullseye to check their contributions.

To run:

1. `cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage ../; make`

1. run tests (`make test`, or other method)

1. `make coverage`

1. `firefox coverage/index.html`
values.title: Adding lcov coverage

summary.raw:
Our bullseye license has expired, and it motivated me to get an open source coverage tool in place. This will also let external users who don't have bullseye to check their contributions.

To run:

1. `cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage ../; make`

1. run tests (`make test`, or other method)

1. `make coverage`

1. `firefox coverage/index.html`
summary.html:
Our bullseye license has expired, and it motivated me to get an open source coverage tool in place. This will also let external users who don't have bullseye to check their contributions.

To run:

  1. cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage ../; make

  2. run tests (make test, or other method)

  3. make coverage

  4. firefox coverage/index.html
